answers.answer: Hi there,The common causes of increased urination are overactive bladder, urinary tract infection, urinary incontinence, diabetes, vaginitis and pregnancy .Drinking many liquids may also cause frequent urination. In UTI or any other urinary system problem a person will have fever, back or side pain, vomiting, or shaking chills. In diabetes a person will have increased thirst or appetite, fatigue, or sudden weight loss. You should consult a doctor and rule out above mentioned possibilities. Do keep me posted.Best luck and regards!

question: i started off about a week ago where I had frequent urination throughout the day and then the last two days i have felt fine throughout the day but around 8 pm it comes back and i go about 4 or 5 times in about an hour or two then i start feeling normal again. what could this be? im 18..also i got a urine test done with no infections
title: help
